w.note: The pl form of the participle is consistent with the General’s speaking to Digenis in unison with his sons, but because the General alone is the subject of the finite verb in the sentence, it seems more likely that the plural form is yet another example of an emergent non-agreeing gerund replacing an original participle.
Ѥсми is a variant of есмь (cf. Schmalstieg §5.5, p. 126)

Devgenij proposes to mark his captives with some sort of disfigurement or defacement before releasing them. The type of marking is unclear, but it may have been cut from or burned into their faces or bodies. See Svetozar Koljević, The epic in the making, Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1980, p. 227. Later in the Digenis text the term пѧтьно is used in place of знамениѥ in a simlar context.
Sarcastically: Is this the type of freedom you are giving us …?
The sources differ in the choice of conjuction; we favor а (Тх) over и (Мс)
There is no verb here in Тх; we follow Tvorogov in inserting зъвати from Тт.
This is in the wrong place in the manuscript; it should read и чѧдъ моихъ и дъщери бꙋдꙋщѧ ѥдинои оу матере.
This is in the wrong place in the manuscript; it should read и чѧдъ моихъ и дъщери бꙋдꙋщѧ ѥдинои оу матере.

From невѣстъка, diminutive of невѣста bride. The nGsg spelling in the manuscript doesn’t fit the sense, but the manuscript reflects the pronunciation of nGsg -ого as /ovo/ elsewhere, so we emend here to a nNsg of a possessive in -ов-.
Class I прослꙋти, прослывꙋть be famous (for)
The sources differ in the choice of conjuction; we favor а (Тх) over и (Мс)
